id.description:
Scottish-Canadian, 57 years old, salt & pepper beard.
Worked his way up the ranks to a Senior Warrant Officer, specifically a _Master_ (cf. GURPS AoN70): “Rheus Master MacEwen”.

aspects.aspect: It’s Not the Years – It’s the Mileage
Fought the Yanks & French in the Skies

character.languages: Speaks English natively, French well enough to function but not well enough to pass as a native speaker, and a small smattering of Ottoman Turkish, tightly focused on the technical topic of ship navigation. Also familiar with the pidgin hand signals common on rheoships (SFoS pg20).

flaws.flaw: Information Might Be Out of Date

benefits.benefit: +2 to Create a Situational Aspect on a topic representing knowledge of it with Lore when given a chance to brush up on a topic: “We’re about to land at Port Lamarck on Mars—let me read up on it.”
Once per Scene, use Lore in place of any other skill for one roll or exchange when invoking an Aspect representing knowledge that would be useful.

stunts.stunt: Spend a Refresh to give our rheoship the _Maneuverable_ Stunt (SFoS pg23)
May use Sail instead of Rapport to Create Advantages about shared experiences when dealing with other naval veterans—even former enemies.
+2 to Sail rolls to create positional Aspects.
May use Will instead of Provoke to Attack when relying on Gordie's military background to intimidate.
May use Sail instead of Rapport to negotiate trade deals.
+2 to Defend against Provoke Attacks specifically related to intimidation and fear.
+2 to Overcome with Resources when invoking an Advantage previously created by myself with Contacts.
Can use Sail when "taking command" of a Rheoship’s use of Stealth (SFoS, pg22).
When you use Will to Defend against feat or intimidation, on a Success With Style instead of gaining a Boost you can inflict a 2-shift mental hit on the attacker. (M12, pg42)
You’ve heard that argument before, and you know how to defeat it. You may use Lore to Defend against Rapport.
+2 to all Lore rolls relating to that field of specialization.
Charts and arithmetic mills will never replace the instincts of a good navigator. +2 to Sail Overcome rolls to improve the speed of a journey.
When it comes to naval battles, you’ve seen every trick in the book. +2 when actively opposing Sail rolls to create positional Aspects.

phase.events:
Born in Coote’s Paradise†, Province of Upper Canada, 1793 to an urban artisan-class family of Scottish immigrants.
Like any loyal colonial subject, Gordon volunteered to defend his home from American invasion in 1812. He served aboard _HMAS Dauntless_, which primarily defended Canada in the skies above Lake Ontario. In its final battle, The _Dauntless_ successfully prevented the _USAS Richard Henry Lee_ from capturing York (now Toronto), forcing it to retreat back to Rochester. _HMAS Dauntless_ sank, but Gordon (obviously) survived.
Gordie also participated in the defense of Britain from French forces. I imagine he took part in the “Battle of Sheffield” in the 1820s or 1830s, being taken prisoner by the French Empire’s forces as they took the city and released when the UK was under secure French control.
I think it’s more interesting to say that instead of being simply anti-French as a result, he has conflicting opinions – perhaps even approving of some of Napoleon’s more liberal policies.
†(Coote’s Paradise was renamed to Dundas in 1814, and is now part of greater Hamilton IRL)
